title: Tropical HEO equals the maximum indicator
statement_md: For a binary indicator $X_S(n)\in\{0,1\}$, $$\boxed{\lim_{t\to 0^+} t\log\sum_{n=1}^N e^{X_S(n)/t} = \max_{1\le n\le N} X_S(n)}.$$ In particular, the tropical HEO observable is $1$ iff there exists at least one hit in the window, and $0$ otherwise.
assumptions_md: Finite window $\{1,\dots,N\}$ with $X_S(n)\in\{0,1\}$. Follows from Laplace's principle / log-sum-exp asymptotics.
evidence: Direct Laplace principle: max-dominates in the $t\to 0^+$ limit
Stable log-sum-exp computation confirms numerically on fixtures
